title: J. Cole and Erykah Badu to Headline Final Dreamville Festival
description: Lil Wayne, 21 Savage, Tems, Keyshia Cole, and others will also take part in the North Carolina event
author: Matthew Strauss
excerpt: Lil Wayne, 21 Savage, Tems, Keyshia Cole, and others will also take part in the North Carolina event
text: The 2025 edition of the Dreamville Festival takes place on Saturday, April 5, and Sunday, April 6, at Dorothea Dix Park in Raleigh, North Carolina. J. Cole and Dreamville have now announced the lineup for the festival.The Saturday headliners are Lil Wayne with Hot Boys (his group with Juvenile, B.G., and Turk) and Big Tymers (the duo of Mannie Fresh and Birdman) and 21 Savage. Then, on Sunday night, J. Cole and Erykah Badu will headline the festival. Others on the bill include Tems, Keyshia Cole (celebrating the 20th anniversary of The Way It Is), Glorilla, Wale, and Ari Lennox. See the lineup in the poster below.The first Dreamville Festival took place in 2019, and the 2025 festival will be the fifth and final installment of the event. “Our team looks forward to welcoming fans from around the world to Dreamville Festival this spring for our fifth anniversary celebration,” the festival’s co-founder and president, Adam Roy, said in a press release. “The first weekend in April has grown to become one of our team’s favorite times of the year as an annual NC reunion.”All products featured on Pitchfork are independently selected by our editors. However, when you buy something through our retail links, we may earn an affiliate commission.
html:
The 2025 edition of the Dreamville Festival takes place on Saturday, April 5, and Sunday, April 6, at Dorothea Dix Park in Raleigh, North Carolina. J. Cole and Dreamville have now announced the lineup for the festival.

The Saturday headliners are Lil Wayne with Hot Boys (his group with Juvenile, B.G., and Turk) and Big Tymers (the duo of Mannie Fresh and Birdman) and 21 Savage. Then, on Sunday night, J. Cole and Erykah Badu will headline the festival. Others on the bill include Tems, Keyshia Cole (celebrating the 20th anniversary of The Way It Is), Glorilla, Wale, and Ari Lennox. See the lineup in the poster below.

The first Dreamville Festival took place in 2019, and the 2025 festival will be the fifth and final installment of the event. “Our team looks forward to welcoming fans from around the world to Dreamville Festival this spring for our fifth anniversary celebration,” the festival’s co-founder and president, Adam Roy, said in a press release. “The first weekend in April has grown to become one of our team’s favorite times of the year as an annual NC reunion.”

All products featured on Pitchfork are independently selected by our editors. However, when you buy something through our retail links, we may earn an affiliate commission.
